title: Railway officials in a tizzy after another rail piece found on tracks in Navi Mumbai | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
Railway officials in a tizzy after another rail piece found on tracks in Navi Mumbai india Updated: Feb 09, 2017 19:00 IST PTI Mumbai A six-foot-long discarded overhead equipment was found lying on the rail tracks between Jasai and Dapoli stations near Uran in Navi Mumbai.(PTI File) 
In yet another suspected act of sabotage within a fortnight, a six-foot-long discarded overhead equipment was found lying on the rail tracks between Jasai and Dapoli stations near Uran in Navi Mumbai, sending Central Railway officials into a tizzy. 
The incident took place around 3am on Wednesday when an alert driver of a JNPT bound goods train, coming from Ratlam in Madhya Pradesh spotted it and applied the brakes resulting in a halt around 50 metres ahead of the abandoned rail piece, a railway official said. 
Subsequently, an FIR against unknown persons was lodged with the Panvel police under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and Railway Act, said the official. 
He said the operating staff was already on high alert following the Diva incident last month. Read more Mumbaiites irked by garbage near rly tracks start Twitter campaign 
According to Sachin Balode, senior divisional security commissioner (RPF) of the Mumbai Division of Central Railway, an investigation into the (current) incident was underway. “We are yet to ascertain whether it is an act of track sabotage,” he said. 
This is third such incident since January 24 when a 7-metre-long rail piece, weighing around 400 kg was found on the tracks near Diva station adjoining Mumbai. The alert train driver of Madgaon-Dadar Janshatabdi Express averted a mishap by applying emergency brakes. 
Earlier this week, on February 6, a huge piece of rail rod was found on the tracks between Kalamboli and Taloja stations at Navi Mumbai in Raigad district. Read more
